channel.title: Documentation on Manual Rede Mapas
channel.description: Recent content in Documentation on Manual Rede Mapas

item.title: Overview
item.description: This is a placeholder page that shows you how to use this template site. The Overview is where your users find out about your project. Depending on the size of your docset, you can have a separate overview page (like this one) or put your overview contents in the Documentation landing page (like in the Docsy User Guide). Try answering these questions for your user in this page: What is it?

item.title: Colaboração com múltiplos repositório no Git
item.description: Contexto e Configuração do Ambiente Projeto Principal e Submódulos: O repositório principal (main) contém a estrutura global do software. Plugins e temas são mantidos em repositórios separados e integrados como submódulos. Para clonar o projeto com todos os submódulos configurados, utilize: git clone --recurse-submodules [URL do repositório principal] Ou, se já tiver clonado sem submódulos, execute: git submodule init git submodule update Ambiente de Desenvolvimento: Configure suas ferramentas (IDE, terminal, etc.

item.title: Concepts
item.description: This is a placeholder page that shows you how to use this template site. For many projects, users may not need much information beyond the information in the Overview, so this section is optional. However if there are areas where your users will need a more detailed understanding of a given term or feature in order to do anything useful with your project (or to not make mistakes when using it) put that information in this section.

item.title: Contribution Guidelines
item.description: These basic sample guidelines assume that your Docsy site is deployed using Netlify and your files are stored in GitHub. You can use the guidelines “as is” or adapt them with your own instructions: for example, other deployment options, information about your doc project’s file structure, project-specific review guidelines, versioning guidelines, or any other information your users might find useful when updating your site. Kubeflow has a great example.
